au.rmit.ract.planning.pathplanning.ai
Class ALSSLRTAStarPlanner

java.lang.Object
  au.rmit.ract.planning.pathplanning.ai.ALSSLRTAStarPlanner
All Implemented Interfaces:
PathPlanner, RTPathPlanner
public class ALSSLRTAStarPlanner
extends java.lang.Object
implements RTPathPlanner

This class provides an implementation of the aLSS-LRTA* path planning algorithm designed by Hern√°ndez et. al. in 2011. This is a real-time search algorithm which finds a part of a shortest path as the agent moves and the environment/world changes, in real time and also uses special technique for heuristic depression avoidance.

Author:
Abhijeet Anand (abhijeet [dot] anand [at] rmit [dot] edu [dot] au)

Constructor Summary
ALSSLRTAStarPlanner(DistanceHeuristics h, int lookahead)
          Creates a Local Search Space - Learning Real-Time A-Star Path Planner using the provided heuristic and the number of lookahead steps, having made no assumptions about the connectedness of the domain.

ALSSLRTAStarPlanner

public ALSSLRTAStarPlanner(DistanceHeuristics h,
                           int lookahead)
Creates a Local Search Space - Learning Real-Time A-Star Path Planner using the provided heuristic and the number of lookahead steps, having made no assumptions about the connectedness of the domain.

Method Detail

expandedNodes

public java.util.ArrayList<State> expandedNodes()
Description copied from interface: PathPlanner
Search algorithms would expand certain nodes while searching for a path. While some algorithms would explore the whole search space, others would only expand a limited set of nodes. This method should return the expanded nodes in the current search iteration.

Specified by:
expandedNodes in interface PathPlanner
Returns:
an ArrayList of Node which were expanded during the current search iteration.

unexpandedNodes

public java.util.ArrayList<State> unexpandedNodes()
Description copied from interface: PathPlanner
Search algorithms would expand certain nodes while searching for a path. While some algorithms would explore the whole search space, others would only expand a limited set of nodes. However, not all the nodes in the search space are expanded though they are prospective frontiers in search. This method should return those unexpanded nodes in the current search iteration.

Specified by:
unexpandedNodes in interface PathPlanner
Returns:
an ArrayList of Node which were not expanded during the current search iteration.

findPath

public Plan findPath(SearchDomain map,
                     State sNode,
                     State tNode)
Description copied from interface: PathPlanner
Find a path from a starting node to the target node within a given map. A client application should call this method whenever it needs to find a path, irrespective of the iteration number.

Specified by:
findPath in interface PathPlanner
Parameters:
map - The SearchDomain to be searched.
sNode - Start State
tNode - Target State
Returns:
Returns a Plan from given start State to the target Node.

Find a path from a starting node to the target node within a given map. A client application should call this method whenever it needs to find a path, irrespective of the iteration number.

findPath in interface RTPathPlanner
Parameters:
map - The SearchDomain to be searched.
sNode - Start State
tNode - Target State

Description copied from interface: PathPlanner
Set the Heuristics to be used with this search. This method is experimental and can be removed in future version if its existence is redundant.

Specified by:
setHeuristics in interface PathPlanner
Returns:

annotations

public java.util.HashMap<State,java.lang.String> annotations()
Description copied from interface: PathPlanner
Search algorithms usually annotate the nodes while expanding/generating them while searching for a path. These annotations are used internally for determining a shortest path by the algorithms. However, if the client needs to know these values it must gain access to them via these method which returns the annotation as a string.

Specified by:
annotations in interface PathPlanner
Returns:
a HashMap of annotations formatted as Strings associated with every Node.
